contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist | name = DJ Rick Adams <!-- Commented out because image was deleted: | image = RickAdams1.jpg --> | caption = Rick Adams on a disney cruise in 2007 | birth_name = Rick Adams | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|10|16|df=y}} | origin = [[Winchester]], [[England]], [[United Kingdom]] | occupation = Television presenter, Internet DJ | years_active = 1992–present | website = [http://www.djrickadams.com DJRickAdams.com] | background=non_performing_personnel }} '''Rick Mark Adams''' (better credited as '''DJ Rick''') (born on 16 October 1971) is an [[England|English]] [[television presenter]] and online radio [[Disk jockey|DJ]]. == Early career == Adams has hosted television and radio shows for a variety of leading networks including [[Nickelodeon UK|Nickelodeon]], [[Children's BBC]], [[Bravo (UK)|Bravo]] and [[ITV]] in the UK on which he presented ''Crazy Cottage'' a wacky kids gameshow. He was a co-presenter of [[Channel 4]]'s ''[[The Big Breakfast]]'' in 1996.<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aoiEjeK1MQE The Big Breakfast - 1996 Relaunch] YouTube</ref><ref>[http://www.ukgameshows.com/ukgs/Rick_Adams Rick Adams] UKGameshows</ref> He has co-hosted [[Nickelodeon]] US's ''[[Slime Time Live]]'' and [[Nickelodeon UK]] telecasts of the US ''[[Kid's Choice Awards]]'', which he co-hosted one year with [[Whitney Houston]]. In 2002 he co-hosted ''Mission: Paintball'' on Bravo TV<ref>[http://www.ukgameshows.com/ukgs/Mission:_Paintball Mission: Paintball] UKGameshows</ref> alongside [[Emily Booth]]. == Radio KOL == Rick Adams hosted [[Radio KOL (Kids Online)|Radio KOL]], the first ever live radio show for children aged 6–15 approximately, broadcast on [[AOL]]. He entertained listeners with guest celebrities visiting the show and a variety of games including MooBaa, where Rick will give a guest 30 seconds to guess whether an animal he names is a cow (by saying Moo) or a sheep (by saying Baa). On 23 November 2007, Rick announced that AOL was planning to cancel Radio KOL and on 28 November 2007, Radio KOL presented its final show. A petition set up by loyal fans was signed by over 500 fans, listeners, KOL Staff, and celebrities, however on 13 February 2008, AOL discontinued all of its live video streams. == CBS Saturday morning == During the 2006-2007 television season, Rick Adams hosted [[CBS]]' ''[[Cookie Jar TV|KOL Secret Slumber Party]]'' TV series, '''''[[Dance Revolution]]''''' inspired by the hit video game franchise, ''[[Dance Dance Revolution]]''. The show ran for one season.
